events.message: The applicant submitted the loan application to cover medical expenses incurred during recent surgery.
The loan application was categorized under personal loans, specifically for medical use as stated.
A loan officer was assigned to the case to begin detailed processing and gather more information.
The initial review involved checking applicant eligibility and verifying the purpose of the personal loan request.
Additional documents were requested including medical bills, proof of income, and identification for verification.
The applicant submitted all requested documents promptly, including detailed medical invoices and employment pay stubs.
Credit check was completed, showing average credit utilization and timely payment history over the last two years.
The risk assessment evaluated the borrower's creditworthiness and personal financial stability for loan approval consideration.
A personal loan offer with a competitive interest rate was presented to the applicant for medical expense coverage.
The applicant provided feedback indicating satisfaction with the offer terms but requested a slightly longer repayment period.
The application was escalated to senior loan officers for review due to the applicant's request for modified repayment conditions.
After review, the personal loan was approved with an adjusted repayment schedule accommodating the applicant’s needs.
The approved loan amount was disbursed to the applicant’s bank account to cover outstanding medical bills promptly.
Follow-up call was conducted to ensure satisfaction with the loan product and offer assistance during the repayment period.
The loan application case was officially closed after successful funding and positive applicant feedback post-disbursement.
